alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 7:04PM CDT until June 30 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL MONROE AND CENTRAL ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 703 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Waterloo, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported tree damage in Columbia, Illinois. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Belleville, Waterloo, Columbia, Freeburg, Dupo, Millstadt, Lemay, Smithton, New Athens, East Carondelet, Hecker, Barr, Floraville, New Hanover, and Paderborn. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
